dtliExcerpt: The production, directed by Sean Mathias, doesn't offer revelatory new insights into Beckett's existential masterpiece. But it does provide the pleasure of watching two master actors bring their considerable skills to bear on roles that seem ideally suited to their theatrical personas.
bwwExcerpt: "... as directed by Sean Mathias, with sturdy supporting performances by Billy Crudup and Shuler Hensley, these productions find the pure entertainment value in existential emptiness. I have never before heard American audiences respond to any production of Pinter or Beckett with such warm and embracing laughter...Now, if you'll allow me (and it will only sting a second), I'm going to offer one major caveat regarding two improbably pleasurable shows. showScoreExcerpt: The production, directed by Sean Mathias, doesn't offer revelatory new insights into Beckett's existential masterpiece. But it does provide the pleasure of watching two master actors bring their considerable skills to bear on roles that seem ideally suited to their theatrical personas.
